content.description: You can start this one by land or from the water. From land, get over to the base of the rock. There is a "trail" from the logical boat landing to the base of the cliff. From there make your way up 4th class ramp with some loose rock to the base of the arete and get on. There are two cruxy sections and the climbing is good and sustained at the grade from the first bolt onward. At this moment, the route is missing the final bolt but a .75 or #1 cam will protect the final moves. NOTE: This project hasn't seen a free ascent on lead yet, just toprope. Will update the page when complete - just created this beta as a sort of place-holder)
content.protection: 8 bolts with a two-bolt anchor on top.
content.location: The GPS point shown for this crag should be accurate. Cross reference with the photos for the area.Â

content.description: Only one route on this asthetic wall so far but there's room for a couple more. At least one more sport climb and a trad climb to come! Stay tuned!
